有啲貼文建議手足使用VPN。雖然多謝手足出於好心嘅建議，當然，佢嘅方向無錯，VPN係可以阻止ISP track 您，係保護你網上私隱既最基本，但VPN其實唔係好信得過，同埋其實完全阻唔到tracking。

VPN 的確可以減少ISP記錄到有關手足嘅data, 但裝置指紋 (device fingerprint) 嘅問題可謂毫無寸進。
即使您已更改 IP address, lots of factors, such as 網站既 persistent tracking cookies, unique identifiers

您也要留意device fingerprint。當您瀏覽一個網站時，該網站會獲得許多關於您browser configuration 及裝置的資訊。

下列包含一些網站管理者會收集、用來辨析瀏覽者身分的資料：
- 瀏覽器的user agent string, e.g.: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows 95; WOW64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/73.0b
- 瀏覽器發放的HTTP ACCEPT header
- 螢幕解析度和顏色深度
- 您系統設定的時區
- 在瀏覽器中安裝的extensions & plugins & add-ons，e.g.: Quicktime, Flash, Java, Acrobat，以及所安裝add-ons的版本
- 安裝在您電腦的字體 (利用Flash或Java來鑑定)
- 您的瀏覽器有沒有執行JavaScript
- 瀏覽器是否接受不同cookies和 "super cookies”
- 由Canvas fingerprinting 所產生的影像 hash
- 由WebGL fingerprinting所產生的影像hash
- 瀏覽器有沒有傳送Do Not Track header
- 您的系統平台，例如Win32, Linux x86
- 您的系統語言，例如en-US
- 您的裝置是否支援觸碰螢幕

(資料來源: https://panopticlick.eff.org/about)

正常當您連上某個網站時，you will automatically broadcast certain information about your browser to the website you are visiting as well as to any trackers embedded within the site (such as those that serve advertisements). 唔止係該網站的管理員可以睇到您browser的information，現今許多網站都會用Facebook嘅 JavaScript trackers disguised as Like/Share buttons on non-Facebook sites (正常，您只要上咗一個有Facebook trackers 嘅 website 就會被track, even if you are not a Facebook user)、persistent, tracking super-cookies、ad brokers嘅 real-time bidding 及 beacons、1x1 pixel 嘅“images” trackers 等不知所謂嘅垃圾，可以將您在不同網站上的活動紀錄串連組合起來。The sites you are visiting may choose to analyze your browser using JavaScript, Flash and other methods. Such methods may include the following, which is an excerpt from this (https://onezero.medium.com/almost-every-website-you-visit-records-exactly-how-your-mouse-moves-4134cb1cc7a0?gi=4a1a47704258) Medium article:

“Session replay services have been around for over a decade and are widely used. [Such services include] FullStory, LogRocket and Inspectlet. [They serve] popular sites like Airbnb, Reddit, and eBay. […] To understand what this type of tracking looks like in practice, I set up FullStory on my site. It was surprisingly easy. I just copied a small, 23-line script and added it to my site’s header which would be a simple task for any web developer and the tracking worked immediately. With almost no development or coding experience, I was able to see what every single visitor to my site did.

In an incognito window, I opened my site and browsed around for a minute. When I came back to my FullStory dashboard, I found a video recreation of every single movement I’d just made waiting for me. I expected the video to show the links I clicked on, and maybe text I highlighted. What surprised me was that the software even recorded when I shook my mouse around while deciding what to click on. It felt like observing digital body language. FullStory even has a feature that tracks what it calls “rage clicks.” This is when a user gets frustrated with a site and starts angrily clicking over and over.
Beyond the replay, FullStory and services like it provide sites with analytics reports on aggregate user behavior and heat maps that show where users have clicked.

Replay services offer tools to selectively exclude or hide information from the third parties they partner with, such as content entered into boxes for passwords or credit card information. But it’s up to sites to format their forms correctly and use the exclusion tools to keep sensitive data out of the recording service’s hands. For example, when […] I added a basic text field and just gave it the label “password,” FullStory was able to see any text entered into the box, even if it was never submitted.

The unique combinations of configurations and data collected through these means allow websites and third-party analytics companies to produce a browser fingerprint - 一個可以用來識別您和您電腦的獨特辨析工具。支国共慘党可以使用這個方法來辨析不同的電腦。

去增加您被 fingerprinted 的難度，您可以使用Tor Browser - VPN does nothing in this regard. I highly recommend you check out these two links:
https://matt.traudt.xyz/posts/you-want-tor-24tFBCJV.html;
https://blog.torproject.org/browser-fingerprinting-introduction-and-challenges-ahead.

Tor Browser是一個FOSS，用以提供匿名瀏覽和繞過審查的功能。Tor Browser aims to 隱藏用家的地理位置和使用網絡的情況，以對抗網絡監控 (network surveillance) 和網絡活動分析 (traffic analysis)。Tor Browser的設計令網站無法根據您的瀏覽器配置而fingerprint (uniquely identify)您，因為如果正確使用最多得3 sets of fingerprint (due to Security Settings blocking some media from displaying)，such that好多使用者對網站看來都是一模一樣的，避免websites辨析獨立的Tor用家。根據預設值，Tor Browser不保留任何瀏覽歷史 (書籤則是 persistent的)。 Cookies 只在單一session內有效, i.e. 所有 cookies 會被當成 session cookies, and will be cleared when you closed Tor Browser or pressed New identity. After you restarted Tor Browser or pressed New Identity, forbidding any zero-day vulnerabilities, all opened tabs will be closed, and you should have a new Tor Circuit and with all browsing history, cookies and other user configurations removed. “New Tor Circuit for this Site” will not remove cookies or change your identity as observed by the website. This is useful if some websites geo-blocked the country wherein the exit node resided.

Even if you connect to two different sites that use the same third-party tracking service / CDN (Content Delivery Network (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_delivery_network#Security_and_privacy), Tor Browser will force the content to be served over two different Tor circuits, so the tracker will not know that both connections originate from your browser.

On the other hand, all connections to a single website address will be made over the same Tor circuit, meaning you can browse different pages of a single website in separate tabs or windows without getting logged out.

Tor建議用家不要更改任何Tor Browser裏的設定，除了Security Settings。Increasing Tor Browser's security level will stop some web pages from functioning properly, so you should weigh your security needs against the degree of usability you require.

Safer disables website features like JavaScript on all non-HTTPS sites (which you should not be browsing anyway, if you must view HTTP sites, please go to https://web[.]archive.org/save/[put HTTP link here]); some fonts and math symbols are disabled; audio and video (HTML5 media) are click-to-play.

Safest disables JavaScript by default on all sites; some fonts, icons, math symbols, and images are disabled; audio and video (HTML5 media) are click-to-play. Tor Browser disables a whole bunch of things as they can become fingerprinting issues which also has the added benefit of reduced attack surface in the browser. Potentially dangerous things such as the JIT compiler and SVG images are disabled.

我建議您把它更改到Safer。Tor Browser裏的安全設定Safest 在所有網站都不允許JavaScript，因此如果您不是一個資深用家的話會使很多網站無法使用。不過以您嘅聰明才智，我諗您只需要試下用Safest mode，慢慢就會識用NoScript來whitelist網站。

通常如果您去https[://]example[.]site, 如果那個網站無法載入，把first-party domain ([…].example[.]site) 更改成Temp Trusted應該就可以了。在Tor Browser裏面, 每一次重新啟動都會清除NoScript的whitelist，所以Trusted跟 Temp Trusted沒有分別。
每當這些字: "ad", "syndication", "tag", “analytics”, “doubleclick[.]com”, “facebook[.]net”, 在NoScript出現，那些通常都是沒有用的trackers而setting them to UNTRUSTED通常不會有負面影響。

請記住即使您使用了Tor而且不允許JavaScript，瀏覽器的視窗大小, 滑鼠/trackpad的動作，打字/手寫的patterns仍然可以用來辨析您的身份。安裝add-ons會破壞您的匿名性，因為那會改變您的browser fingerprint，一些add-ons甚至能繞過proxy 設定，因而完全繞過Tor。 所以 Tor Project 建議您不要加任何add-ons或變更任何設定，包括視窗大小。預設嘅視窗大小是1000x1000 pixels。但當不能做到時，它會變成最近的100x100倍數。放大或縮小、變更瀏覽器的視窗大小 、zoom-in 會改變瀏覽器的視窗大小，as determined by CSS. 最恐怖嘅係，CSS alone就足夠泄漏您的視窗大小，JavaScript 都唔使。所以即使您將 security settings 設至 Safest，如果您的視窗大小夠獨特，您也有可能會被deanonymized。 (https://matt.traudt.xyz/p/YF4ciVY6.html; https://demos.traudt.xyz/css/media/index.html)

How the Tor Network works:
In addition to the aforementioned fingerprinting protection, the Tor Browser Bundle (TBB, or just Tor Browser) directs your browsing activities to 3個隨機選擇的nodes, which are operated by volunteers with the technical knowhow from across the globe. There are 7000 nodes at the time of writing (Feb 14, 2020).

Tor Browser forms a new Tor Circuit for every website you are browsing to protect your identity (however, do note that https[://]example[.]site shares the same Tor circuit as https[://]hi[.]example[.]site). Your browsing activities are symmetrically encrypted thrice as they reach the first of the 3 Tor nodes, called a Guard node or an Entry node, which will be responsible for serving your request. This Entry node 會「剝」開一層加密，透露your request的下個目的地。The second node knows nothing about you or what website you are browsing, 因為每一個node都只知道 the origin and destination of the browsing activities. Therefore 沒有一個 entity 可以同時知道您是誰 and 您瀏覽嘅網站。當最後一層加密被解密後，your request will exit the Tor network and will be sent to the website (hopefully HTTPS). Please try out this interactive infographic: https://www.eff.org/pages/tor-and-https

This is also known as “onion routing” as the browsing activities are protected in many layers，像洋蔥的外皮一般。Encryption also means that if the nodes try to modify anything, it will make the request corrupted and void.

與VPN不同的是，如果您使用VPN, 所有網絡活動都經過由一個 entity (VPN 公司) 控制的一個伺服器。這表示如果VPN公司被hack 或 subpoenaed to 秘密法庭或公司的員工被賄賂, you will be profiled. Even if you are not subjected to these sinister scenarios, VPNs do not offer first-party isolation (i.e. all your network requests are sent through the same server(s)), do not offer any fingerprinting protection, knows who you are and what websites you are browsing at the same time, and is only secure if you trust that they and the servers that they rent, and the companies administering the servers do not log and sell customer data. 好多 VPN 公司都係空殼公司，私底下在另一個有寬鬆私隱條例的國家運作; 一些公司聲稱他們的伺服器runs on RAM (such that沒有資料是被儲存多於幾秒), but they are unable to prove that 所有伺服器在所有時間都是咁樣運作的。最耐人尋味的是, 支国共慘党的 GFW能夠阻擋大部分 Tor 的 pluggable transports such as meek-azure (which are specially designed to prevent anyone monitoring the network to detect Tor traffic), 但支国共慘党竟然允許一些 single-point-of-failure 的VPN 不停運作，縱然它們能夠輕易被阻擋？ 班磚家仲要係二十四小時工作的。我非常有信心那些能在大劣淪陷區用到的 VPN 是 ʕᴥʔ曱維尼所設下嘅「冚鄭」, 係個陽謀, 遲下 (如果咁都唔支爆) 曱維尼就會將啲「密唐」一網打盡 。Please see this video for more information about VPNs: https://youtube.com/watch?v=6ohvf03NiIA

由個純理論嘅角度講 (attack個 protocol)，同時控制第一個 node和第三個 node (and/or controls/watches the website you visit, but if that is the case then you would be tracked 100% of the time if not using Tor) 是唯一可以聯繫到 Tor 用戶的互聯網活動的方法; 第一個 node 會幾個月不變，because if Tor selected new entry and exit relays each time you used the Tor network, the attacker will be able to correlate all traffic you send with probability around (c/n)^2. But profiling is, for most users, as bad as being traced all the time: they want to do something often without an attacker noticing, and the attacker noticing once is as bad as the attacker noticing more often. Thus, choosing many random entries and exits gives the user no chance of escaping profiling by this kind of attacker. With "entry guards", each Tor client selects a few relays at random to use as entry points, and uses only those relays for her first hop. If those relays are not controlled or observed, the attacker will be unable to correlate users. For details on these techniques (unnecessary for the purposes of browsing securely), please refer to: https://www.onion-router.net/Publications/locating-hidden-servers.pdf#subsection.4.2. If those relays are observed or controlled by the attacker, the attacker sees a larger fraction of the user's traffic but still the user is no more profiled than before. Thus, the user has some chance, on the order of (n-c)/n, of avoiding profiling, whereas she had none before.

Please see:
https://2019.www.torproject.org/docs/faq.html.en
https://robertheaton.com/2019/04/06/how-does-tor-work/ (Note that this guide is not entirely correct. Notably, the author described Bridges as another hop before Guard nodes, but actually the Bridges replace the Guard nodes. However the bridge is still pinned.)

I would also like to recommend you to read up on all the security precautions the Tor Project included. It is very important that you know the tools that you are using

Windows or Mac or GNU/Linux: https://www.torproject.org/download/

為了在手提電話上使用 Tor, 您也可以在Android電話裏安裝Orbot和Tor Browser，iOS電話則可以安裝Onion Browser, 雖然這不是官方的。

Android (for Tor-rifying other apps):
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.torproject.android
Android (Tor Browser; please do not Tor-rify another browser):
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.torproject.torbrowser
iOS (unofficial but recommended by the Tor Project): https://apps.apple.com/us/app/onion-browser/id519296448
iOS (for Tor-rifying other apps; not officially recognized): https://github.com/iCepa/iCepa

I do not use iOS. These apps are only recommended to you for reference only.

Orbot是一個FOSS that routes and encrypts Android 應用程式的internet traffic to the Tor Network。Orbot 使用 Android 的VPN 功能 (但其實並不是個 VPN)。 利用 Orbot，您可以選擇 route 一些 apps through Tor.

While normally您可以在 Android 上使用 Tor Browser 而不需要 Orbot not if you used Block connections without VPN.

I recommend 您 route 所有需要連接互聯網的 apps * through Tor, 和禁止所有不需要連接互聯網的 apps 連接到互聯網, to do this:

i. 在 Tor-Enabled Apps 裏面, 不選擇不需要連上互聯網的應用程式；Enable VPN Mode within Orbot; Make sure the onion in Orbot is green;

ii. 在電話 Settings裏面, 設定 VPN always-on 和Block connections without VPN 到ON; 注意這樣會減慢連接速度和使像 YouTube 和 WhatsApp/Signal’s Voice over IP (VoIP) 不能運作, 因此在上面提到的Shelter 配合 work profile會在這情況裏非常有用, 因為 blocking 不能夠延伸到 work profile 裏面；I recommend that you put your private Signal in the Work Profile (contrary to the usual dogma of putting untrusted apps in Work Profile as recommended by Shelter), because that does not block VoIP calls and your private Signal would be the one which receives calls from close and trusted people. Wherever possible, I recommend you avoid apps that only offer marginal convenience gains such as weather apps and the YouTube app. A simple Startpage search (basically uses Google searches but without any manipulation / censorship of search data based on what Google wants you to see / anticipates you would like to see, accessible at https://startpage.com) would yield you the weather forecast anyway, and YouTube as accessed through the Tor Browser prevents Google from tracking you, and has the added benefit of avoiding Google from putting you in an echo chamber.

iii. Start Orbot on Boot, Always-On Notifications, Allow Background Starts, Isolate destination addresses 都設定到ON; 沒有其他設定應該被變更

* If you use mobile banking apps (and apps that treat Tor users poorly), I recommend you put them within Work Profile, and enable the Shelter setting that restricts background activity for them. Do bear in mind that it will be using your IP address instead of that of the Tor exit node’s regardless of what settings you made outside of Work Profile; using Work Profile is beneficial as you will not have to turn off Block connections without VPN, which would also enable internet access for all apps (Those that remain unticked in Tor-Enabled Apps could then transmit data that is not through Tor).

Alternatively, if you have a phone that runs Android 10, I recommend you disable Internet for individual apps that do not need connection at all times and are not banking apps in the phone Settings, but include them in Tor-Enabled Apps. When you are using those apps, grant them the Internet access in the phone Settings again, and revoke it as soon as you don’t need it. That way it can only transmit data when you are using it and your identity is always anonymized.
